@metadata.goal: The student can partition shapes into equal parts

steps.dialogue: Look at these three bars. One of them is divided into 2 equal parts. Which one shows halves?

prompt.text: Select the bar divided into 2 equal parts

step.dialogue: Not quite. Look for the bar with 2 equal parts.

events.name: pulse_unequal_sections
events.description: Top bar's unequal sections pulse to show size difference

events.name: pulse_equal_sections_middle
events.description: Middle bar's equal sections pulse together

events.name: pulse_equal_sections_bottom
events.description: Bottom bar's equal sections pulse together

step.dialogue: [event:pulse_unequal_sections][event:pulse_equal_sections_middle][event:pulse_equal_sections_bottom]Let's think about this together. For halves, we need exactly 2 parts that are the same size. Check each bar carefully.

events.name: measure_sections_unequal
events.description: Measurement lines appear showing the two sections are different widths

events.name: count_sections
events.description: Numbers 1, 2, 3 appear sequentially over each section

events.name: measure_sections_equal
events.description: Measurement lines appear confirming both sections are equal width, then the bar glows to indicate correct answer

step.dialogue: [event:measure_sections_unequal][event:count_sections][event:measure_sections_equal]This can be tricky, so let's work through it together. Halves means 2 equal parts. The top bar has 2 parts, but they're different sizes. The bottom bar has equal parts, but there are 3 of them. The middle bar has exactly 2 equal parts - that's halves.

on_correct.dialogue: You found the bar with 2 equal parts.

@metadata.goal: The student can shade one part to represent a unit fraction

steps.dialogue: Look at these three bars. Each one is divided into thirds, but only one shows [fraction numerator=1 denominator=3]one third[/fraction] shaded correctly.

step.dialogue: Check how many parts are shaded in each bar.

events.name: pulse_shaded_sections
events.description: The shaded sections in each bar pulse to show the count

step.dialogue: [event:pulse_shaded_sections]Let's think about this together. [fraction numerator=1 denominator=3]One third[/fraction] means exactly 1 out of 3 equal parts is shaded. Count the shaded sections in each bar.

events.name: count_shaded_with_label
events.description: Animated counting overlays appear on all bars showing shaded count and fraction labels

step.dialogue: [event:count_shaded_with_label]This can be tricky, so let's work through it together. [fraction numerator=1 denominator=3]One third[/fraction] means 1 out of 3 equal parts. The top bar has 2 parts shaded, so that's [fraction numerator=2 denominator=3]two thirds[/fraction]. The bottom bar has 0 parts shaded. The middle bar has exactly 1 part shaded out of 3 equal parts - that's [fraction numerator=1 denominator=3]one third[/fraction]. That's how unit fractions work - just one part shaded.

on_correct.dialogue: You found the bar with [fraction numerator=1 denominator=3]one third[/fraction] shaded.

@metadata.goal: The student can shade one part to represent a unit fraction

steps.dialogue: Look at these three bars. Each one is divided into 2 equal parts. Which bar shows exactly [fraction numerator=1 denominator=2]one half[/fraction] shaded?

step.dialogue: Not quite. Look for the bar with exactly 1 out of 2 parts shaded.

events.name: pulse_shaded_sections
events.description: The two shaded sections in the top bar pulse to show both parts are shaded

events.name: pulse_shaded_sections
events.description: The one shaded section in the middle bar pulses to show only one part is shaded

events.name: pulse_all_sections
events.description: Both sections in the bottom bar pulse to show no parts are shaded

step.dialogue: [event:pulse_shaded_sections][event:pulse_shaded_sections][event:pulse_all_sections]Let's think about this together. [fraction numerator=1 denominator=2]One half[/fraction] means 1 part shaded out of 2 equal parts. Count how many parts are shaded in each bar.

events.name: overlay_counting_shaded
events.description: Animated overlay counts the shaded sections: '1... 2' with an X mark appearing to indicate this is not 1/2

events.name: overlay_counting_shaded
events.description: Animated overlay shows '0 shaded' with an X mark appearing to indicate this is not 1/2

events.name: demonstrate_unit_fraction
events.description: Animated overlay counts '1 shaded out of 2 equal parts' with a checkmark and '1/2' label appearing to confirm this represents one-half

step.dialogue: [event:overlay_counting_shaded][event:overlay_counting_shaded][event:demonstrate_unit_fraction]This can be tricky, so let's work through it together. [fraction numerator=1 denominator=2]One half[/fraction] means 1 part shaded out of 2 equal parts. The top bar has 2 parts shaded - that's [fraction numerator=2 denominator=2]two halves[/fraction], not [fraction numerator=1 denominator=2]one half[/fraction]. The bottom bar has 0 parts shaded. The middle bar has exactly 1 part shaded out of 2 - that's [fraction numerator=1 denominator=2]one half[/fraction]. That's how halves work - 1 out of 2 equal parts.

on_correct.dialogue: You found the bar with [fraction numerator=1 denominator=2]one half[/fraction] shaded.

@metadata.goal: The student can shade one part to represent a unit fraction

steps.dialogue: Here's a bar with one part shaded. Which fraction matches it?

prompt.text: Select the fraction that matches the shaded part

step.dialogue: Not quite. Count how many equal parts the bar has total.

events.name: pulse_sections
events.description: Each section of bar_1 pulses sequentially to emphasize there are 2 equal parts total

step.dialogue: [event:pulse_sections]Let's think about this together. The bottom number tells how many equal parts total, and the top tells how many are shaded.

events.name: count_total_parts
events.description: Animated overlay counts each section with numbers 1, 2 appearing sequentially to show 2 total parts

events.name: highlight_shaded
events.description: The shaded section glows to emphasize 1 part is shaded

step.dialogue: [event:count_total_parts][event:highlight_shaded]This can be tricky, so let's work through it together. The bar has 2 equal parts total. One part is shaded. That means 1 out of 2 parts is shaded, which we write as [fraction numerator=1 denominator=2]one half[/fraction]. That's how fractions work - the bottom number shows total equal parts.

on_correct.dialogue: You matched [fraction numerator=1 denominator=2]one half[/fraction] correctly.
